node.text: Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) is showing us her take on a classic gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from her Indian heritage. With curry leaves, mango, and lime juice, this tangy and super refreshing cocktail feels like summer in a glass. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Curry Leaf and Mango G&T

node.text: Al Thompson (@drunkenmixologist) shares his version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. With the combination of bright, citrusy grapefruit and floral lavender, this G&T becomes the perfect rooftop cocktail. Simple. Refreshing. Delicious. #StirCreativity

node.text: Watch as @eatwithchrissy makes a tangy, slightly spicy margarita using @cointreau_us, Scotch bonnet peppers, grapefruit, lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita uses Scotch Bonnet peppers to give a satisfying kick.

node.title: Margarita Season: Scotch Bonnet and Grapefruit Margarita

node.text: Watch as @andybaraghani makes a sweet and refreshing margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled pineapple and mint, and lime, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita is quite possibly *the* drink of summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Crushed Pineapple and Mint Margarita

node.text: Melissa Miranda (@meltronica) shares her version of a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus, taking inspiration from the Philippines with a riff on the Gin Pom. With grapefruit, ginger, cardamom bitters, a squeeze of lime, and @bombaysapphireus, this drink will remind you of being on the beach. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Ginger Grapefruit G&T

node.text: Julie Reiner (@mixtressnyc) is showing us how to make her spin on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. Julie grew up in Hawai'i and uses that for her inspiration, with watermelon, lemon, and coconut water for a bright burst of summer. #StirCreativity

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Watermelon Coconut G&T

node.text:
**Sound On** In honor of Mother’s Day, best-selling author and poet Kwame Alexander (@kwamealexander) asked 12 accomplished writers to reflect on how their lives—and their kitchens—mirror their mothers. Everyone got the same prompt, “I am becoming my mother,” and this community poem is a result. Head to the link in our bio to read more about the authors.
Contributors: @vanggarrett, Lesléa Newman, @engle.margarita, @marjorythw, Richard Michelson, Janet Wong, @georgiaheard1, @amstephens_, Maritza Rivera, Reuben Jackson, Lorna Goodison, @erikalsanchez, Deanna Nikaido, and Kwame Alexander

node.title: Kwame Alexander Reads The Ceremony of Giving

node.text: Watch as @empschultz makes a salty blueberry and ginger Margarita using @cointreau_us, muddled blueberry, ginger simple syrup, and blanco tequila. This riff on The Original Margarita was inspired by a blueberry, ginger, and orange pie she made last summer.

node.title: Margarita Season: Salty Blueberry & Ginger Margarita

node.text: DeVonn Francis (@tuna__turner) is showing us how to make his unique take on a gin and tonic with @bombaysapphireus. DeVonn uses pineapple as a nod to his Caribbean roots, celery to compliment the herbaceous notes in the gin, and bay leaf to tie all the ingredients in his Pineapple Celery G&T.

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Pineapple Celery G&T

node.title: 99 Gin and Tonics: Black Pepper G+T

node.text: #Ad Esther Choi (@choibites), chef/owner of @mokbar_nyc, is showing us how to make a mandu stir-fry with lots of vegetables and of course, @bibigoUSA’s mandu.

node.text: Think of this collection of tomato recipes as your late summer to-do list. Grab a couple of heavy beefsteaks, a few pints of Sungolds, and an armful of heirlooms and get ready to tomato-fy all the soups, pies, and sandwiches your heart desires. From pastas to salads to salsas, hit the link in our bio for all the fresh tomato recipes you need to make before summer is over. 📷: @emmafishman, @yungbludlau, @mamadivisuals🍴: @susietheodorou, @heysueli, @dbrownfoodstyle, @mpearljones 🥣: @elle_jaime, @tripleppp, shannymaldonado

node.text: Have a couple tins of mackerel lying around? Use them to make this speedy, flavorful pantry pasta! Senior food editor Christina Chaey (@seechaey) borrows a technique from Joie Warner’s 'No-Cook Pasta Sauces' and warms the mackerel gently in a heatproof bowl set over the pasta water, which ensures that the fish doesn't dry out. Click the link in our bio for this weeknight-friendly, company-worthy dish. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 23, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: In this quick weeknight stir-fry, green beans are cut into bite-size pieces and seasoned with a spicy sauce that pairs perfectly with slightly sweet, coconutty tofu. Senior editor Sarah Jampel (@sarahjampel) loves that green beans cut this way cook super fast—we’re talking 3 minutes—and arrive at her ideal tender-yet-crisp happy place. Click the link in our bio for the full recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @susietheodorou 🥣: @elle_jaime

node.text: From searing a deeply caramelized crust to achieving that perfectly pink medium-rare temperature, @andybaraghani shares his favorite method for cooking steak at home. Watch the full video YouTube at the link in our bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 22, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: This saucy shredded chicken takes inspiration from Mexican chicken tinga. Senior food editor Christina Chaey (@seechaey) harnesses the wonderful complexity of dried chiles, which simmer with onions, tomatoes, spices, and broth to slowly braise the chicken while also adding a ton of flavor. Enjoy this fall-apart tender chicken on top of tostadas, in rice bowls, or as a filling for enchiladas and tacos. Hit the link in our bio for the recipe. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

Like finding just a dribble of milk left in the carton, discovering one lonely olive left in the jar can be devastating. But even after you eat the last olive, an unexpected star remains: olive brine. And writer Katy Frank is asking you—begging you!—not to throw it out. This basically free ingredient can add salt and umami to all kinds of dishes. Essentially salt water that’s been infused with the deep, alluring flavor of olives, this brine is an incredibly versatile condiment of sorts. It’s a pop of flavor wherever it is needed. Hit the link in our bio to read more on this not-so-secret ingredient to add more depth to your meals. 📷: @emmafishman

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 21, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Unsweetened cocoa powder can truly transform a savory dish. Its luxurious richness adds depth to proteins, like the catfish in this recipe from Nicole A. Taylor (@foodculturist), featured in @bryantterry’s book ‘Black Food.’ Throw some fresh orange juice and crunchy benne seeds into the mix, and you have a simple fish dish that's packed with complexity. Hit the link in our bio to make this dish ASAP. 📷: Oriana Koren 🍴: @mrsmochi 🥣: @jjoules

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 20, 2021. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Let's hear it for Blue Drinks! You know, the ones that taste like juice and look like Windex. The ones that often come bearing tiny paper umbrellas or a small school of Swedish Fish. The ones that—fun fact!—used to get their color from coal tar. These are contributor Sophia Stewart's favorite drinks, and sneer all you want but they are the perfect summer cocktail. Head to the link in our bio to read Stewart’s defense of her favorite neon cocktails—and the story behind where these things came from (starting with that whole coal tar thing). 📷: @isa.zapata

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 20, 2021. May be an image of food.

node.text: Since fish cooks relatively quickly, the real challenge is packing it with lots of flavor without drying it out. In this recipe, associate food editor Rachel Gurjar (@rachelgurjar) slips the fillets into a tomato bath infused with Indian spices like cumin and garam masala. The result? Sublimely flaky fish that’s anything but bland. Click the link in our bio to make this simple and delicious fish curry. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @rebeccajurkevich 🥣: @sophiestrangio

node.text: We challenged Chris Morocco (@moroccochris) to recreate @ciaosamin's ravioli verdi using every sense he has - other than sight. Was he up to the challenge? Watch the full video on YouTube at the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 19, 2021. May be an image of food and indoor.

node.text: Take advantage of tomato season while you still can with this salad adapted from Connecticut’s Mayflower Inn. It’s a house specialty so special that regulars—like bestselling author Dani Shapiro (@daniwriter) who wrote about it in our September issue—have been known to revolt when it’s not on the menu. Yes, it’s that good. You can’t go wrong with blue cheese, fresh tomatoes, and frizzled shallots. Hit the link in our bio to make this salad tonight. 📷: @isa.zapata 🍴: @curlygirlcooks

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by bonappetitmag on August 19, 2021. May be an image of drink.

node.text: Okay, yes, it’s August, but summer isn’t over *yet.* We’ve been keeping our ovens off and hanging out in the shade, and, like everyone, drinking booze out of cans. But the Cool Drinks Economy is inflated with canned beverages in various colors, flavors, and ~vibes~. So our staff came up with a list of our favorite drinks in a can (including some nonalcoholic picks) plus the ideal scenarios to consume them. Click the link in our bio to check them out, track them down, and bring them to whatever summer activities you’re squeezing in before it’s sweater weather again. 📷: @emmafishman 🍴: @aeswist
